answers.answer: Can you go back in to get rechecked? It might come back negative again, but that would give me peace of mind knowing I went back.
You should go get rechecked, better safe than sorry (:

Same this is happening to me I will be 39 weeks and I'm so scare that something can happen to the baby I know is not a good idea but I requested a induction at first my doctor didn't want to then she checked me and she scheduled the induction for Tuesday
I will be 39 weeks tomorrow I can't take my feet  and the found protein in my urine as well and also something one liver is really high

I have protein in my urine and my blood pressure is borderline. They don't think I have preeclampsia cos the blood results don't indicate I do, but they are still monitoring me incase that changes. It's always good to have a doctor that is willing to do the extra work to make sure you and Bub are fine. As I said, the fact I have protein in my urine is reason enough to be monitored just as a precaution. Maybe you should speak your concerns to your doctor.
Thanks ladies for ur input. I am trying to relax and going back to doctors on Monday.

With my first,  I was threatened with preclampsia. I was swollen,  had protein in my urine,  but bp was okay... if they had me lay down! I had midwives and  I had my baby at a birth center, so things are a little more lax if you know what I mean. They didnt seem worried but I was scared because my feet were balloons and I saw the per stick results myself. The fact my bp was bad, unless I was laying down, was really what freaked me out. Everything turned out fine though. I was on mild bed rest the last few weeks. I had to prop my feet up all the time and eat lots of protein and drink tons of water (sounds counter-productive but it actually helps) and I went into labor naturally on week 39. Im sure you'll be fine too. Just be careful and drink that water and eat that cottage cheese!

question: Today went to check up and I had protein and sugar in urine and very swollen. My blood pressure was normal though. So they monitored me for two hours and sent me home. Now I am worried I have preeclamcia and the doctor isn't taking it serious enough. I have been swollen for a week. My husband want to take me to a hospital. Anyone else experience anything like this? I'll be 37 weeks this weekend.
title: preeclamcia question
